# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `ah`
* Variable label: `Arterial hypertension`
* Variable description: `Arterial hypertension. Means of all diastolic blood pressure measures.`
* Domain: `Physical Measures`
* Value type: `Categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | no hypertension
1        | hypertension

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done 
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

```{r lab, echo=FALSE}
ds_label <- "Arterial hypertension"
ds_label_all <- "Arterial hypertension. Means of all diastolic blood pressure measures."
```

```{r local_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- t1066_ah$sbp

kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3])

pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(t1066_ah, aes(dbp)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab("Diastolic Blood Pressure") + ylab("Frequency") + xlim(40,140)
```


#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable, first of all, it has to be created two categorical variables as follows:

* dh:
  + `dbp >= 90 into 1`
  + `dbp < 90 into 0`

* sh:
  + `sbp >= 140 into 1`
  + `sbp < 140 into 0`

After that, to compute the harmonized variable from this two variables has to be recoded as follows:

* `if dh = 0 and sh = 0 into 0`
* `if dh = 1 and sh = 0 into 1`
* `if dh = 0 and sh = 1 into 1`
* `if dh = 1 and sh = 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_cuba1}
t1066_ah$dh <- car::recode(t1066_ah$dbp, "0:89.99999999=0; 90:900=1")
t1066_ah$sh <- car::recode(t1066_ah$sbp, "0:139.9999999=0; 140:900=1")

t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_ah$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah <- NA
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==0 & t1066_ah$sh==0)] <- 0
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==1 & t1066_ah$sh==0)] <- 1
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==0 & t1066_ah$sh==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==1 & t1066_ah$sh==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==999 & t1066_ah$sh==999)] <- 999

t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah, labels = c("no hypertension"=0, "hypertension"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
vari <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$ah
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(ah))) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency") 
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
```

```{r save_cuba1, echo=FALSE}
ah <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1
save(ah, file = "../RData/cuba_w1/ah.RData")
rm(ah)
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable, first of all, it has to be created two categorical variables as follows:

* dh:
  + `dbp >= 90 into 1`
  + `dbp < 90 into 0`

* sh:
  + `sbp >= 140 into 1`
  + `sbp < 140 into 0`

After that, to compute the harmonized variable from this two variables has to be recoded as follows:

* `if dh = 0 and sh = 0 into 0`
* `if dh = 1 and sh = 0 into 1`
* `if dh = 0 and sh = 1 into 1`
* `if dh = 1 and sh = 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_RP1}
t1066_ah$dh <- car::recode(t1066_ah$dbp, "0:89.99999999=0; 90:900=1")
t1066_ah$sh <- car::recode(t1066_ah$sbp, "0:139.9999999=0; 140:900=1")

t1066_ds_RP_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_ah$id)
t1066_ds_RP_w1$ah <- NA
t1066_ds_RP_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==0 & t1066_ah$sh==0)] <- 0
t1066_ds_RP_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==1 & t1066_ah$sh==0)] <- 1
t1066_ds_RP_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==0 & t1066_ah$sh==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_RP_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==1 & t1066_ah$sh==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_RP_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==999 & t1066_ah$sh==999)] <- 999
t1066_ds_RP_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==999 & t1066_ah$sh==0)] <- 999
t1066_ds_RP_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==999 & t1066_ah$sh==1)] <- 1


t1066_ds_RP_w1$ah <- labelled(t1066_ds_RP_w1$ah, labels = c("no hypertension"=0, "hypertension"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable, first of all, it has to be created two categorical variables as follows:

* dh:
  + `dbp >= 90 into 1`
  + `dbp < 90 into 0`

* sh:
  + `sbp >= 140 into 1`
  + `sbp < 140 into 0`

After that, to compute the harmonized variable from this two variables has to be recoded as follows:

* `if dh = 0 and sh = 0 into 0`
* `if dh = 1 and sh = 0 into 1`
* `if dh = 0 and sh = 1 into 1`
* `if dh = 1 and sh = 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:**


```{r harmo_RM1}
t1066_ah$dh <- car::recode(t1066_ah$dbp, "0:89.99999999=0; 90:900=1")
t1066_ah$sh <- car::recode(t1066_ah$sbp, "0:139.9999999=0; 140:900=1")

t1066_ds_RM_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_ah$id)
t1066_ds_RM_w1$ah <- NA
t1066_ds_RM_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==0 & t1066_ah$sh==0)] <- 0
t1066_ds_RM_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==1 & t1066_ah$sh==0)] <- 1
t1066_ds_RM_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==0 & t1066_ah$sh==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_RM_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==1 & t1066_ah$sh==1)] <- 1
t1066_ds_RM_w1$ah[which(t1066_ah$dh==999 & t1066_ah$sh==999)] <- 999

t1066_ds_RM_w1$ah <- labelled(t1066_ds_RM_w1$ah, labels = c("no hypertension"=0, "hypertension"=1, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```
